actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-210, by Mr. Moakley.
Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 1278. The resolution waives all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 47.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 348 - 74 (Roll no. 212).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against the conference report on the bill (H.R. 1278) to reform, recapitalize, and consolidate the Federal deposit insurance system, to enhance the regulatory and enforcement powers of Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies, and for other purposes, and against consideration of such conference report.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the conference report on H.R. 1278 (banking regulation) and against its consideration.

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against the conference report on the bill (H.R. 1278) to reform, recapitalize, and consolidate the Federal deposit insurance system, to enhance the regulatory and enforcement powers of Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies, and for other purposes, and against consideration of such conference report.
